newsitem.title: USA: InterCel unit buys more PCS blocks.
newsitem.headline: InterCel unit buys more PCS blocks.

text.p: InterCel Inc said on Wednesday its Powertel unit had won more personal communications service licenses for adjoining blocks through a Federal Communications Commission (FCC) auction.

The company said in a statement Powertel had spent $31.2 million, or $4.98 per individual, for the licenses. They were sold through the FCC's D-, E- and F-Block auctions to provide personal communications service service to 13 areas in Kentucky, Tennessee and Indiana.
The new license areas add 65,767 square miles to Powertel's previous 180,000 contiguous square mile coverage area, and covers a population of 6.2 million potential users.
The company is providing personal communication services in the Birmingham, Ala; Jacksonville, Fla.; and Memphis, Tenn./Jackson, Miss., areas.
